attributes.comment:
I'm writing to complain about the proposed huge increase in fees for adoptions.
Not only are the fees themselves going up to an unconscionable level, but since
it's common for international adoptions to take longer than 18 months, adoptive
families will have to pay these fees twice. That's an increase of $975 for the I600A
and required fingerprints--an intolerable burden on people who are already
financially maxxed out trying to adopt.

I'm also complaining about the proposed increase in the application fee for the
Certificate of Citizenship. A $245 increase is, again, unconscionable. These are
the children of American citizens, and we should not be engaging in price gouging
for these financially stressed families.

I urge you to hold the line on fees for adoptive families. Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parent, Maria Valenta
